neighbors.name: Wade Wendall Johnson & Max Johnson
neighbors.claims: The Johnson family owns land along Chulio Road adjacent to the Rome Speedway tract that was recently considered for industrial rezoning ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=The%20applicant%20was%20seeking%20to,the%20property%20for%20industrial%20use)). They were among local residents who opposed the 124-acre heavy industrial proposal, citing likely impacts on farm operations, traffic, and property values ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=Some%20nearby%20residents%20opposed%20the,and%20the%20impact%20on%20agriculture)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected Farm Bureau member or fellow farmer reach out, focusing on commitments to preserve agricultural land and maintain local property values. Address truck route planning to alleviate their traffic concerns.

neighbors.name: Michael Todd Waters
neighbors.claims: Michael Todd Waters resides on a rural property in the same area near the Rome Speedway on Chulio Road ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=The%20applicant%20was%20seeking%20to,the%20property%20for%20industrial%20use)). He joined other neighbors in objecting to the proposed heavy industrial rezoning of 124 acres, voicing concerns about road safety, loss of agricultural use, and declining real estate values ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=Some%20nearby%20residents%20opposed%20the,and%20the%20impact%20on%20agriculture)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet personally through a local agriculture extension meeting or community group, and discuss the project’s measures to safeguard farmland and keep property values stable. Emphasize plans to control heavy truck traffic to protect rural roads.

neighbors.name: Johnette T. Chambers
neighbors.claims: Johnette T. Chambers is a landowner in the vicinity of the Rome Speedway site and surrounding farmland ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=The%20applicant%20was%20seeking%20to,the%20property%20for%20industrial%20use)). Like her neighbors, she opposed the 2024 attempt to rezone 124 acres to Heavy Industrial, citing potential threats to local farming activities, increased traffic burden, and home property devaluation ([www.mykcountry.com](https://www.mykcountry.com/2024/08/27/county-commission-denies-without-prejudice-heavy-industrial-rezoning-off-chulio-road-and-highway-411/#:~:text=Some%20nearby%20residents%20opposed%20the,and%20the%20impact%20on%20agriculture)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a familiar community figure (such as a trusted neighbor or farm co-op leader) to discuss how the development can coexist with farming traditions and not diminish land value. Highlight any commitments to mitigate traffic and noise impacts.

overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors are rural landowners in Floyd County who have expressed concerns about nearby development. Each has opposed a recent heavy industrial rezoning proposal in their area, highlighting issues like traffic, farmland impact, and property values. None hold public office, and their community influence is primarily as longtime local residents rather than formal leaders.
